citation.article-title: Deefgea rivuli gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the class Betaproteobacteria
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Deefgea [De.ef.ge′a. N.L. fem. n. Deefgea arbitrary name derived from the acronym DFG for Deutsche Forschungsgemeinschaft (German Science Foundation)].
Cells are Gram-negative, rod-shaped (0.7–0.8×3–4 μm) and facultatively anaerobic.
They occur mostly singly (Fig. 1a) and are motile by means of a single flagellum (Fig. 1b) or rarely two polar flagella.
Colonies on R2A are circular, convex and pearl white.
Polar lipids are phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol.
Major cellular fatty acids (>10 %) are C16 : 0 and C16 : 1ω7c.
The G+C content of the DNA is 49 mol%.

Based on 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, Deefgea belongs to the class Betaproteobacteria, family Neisseriaceae, showing a distant relatedness to Chitinibacter tainanensis, Silvimonas terrae and Formivibrio citricus.
The type species is Deefgea rivuli.
